intro: Oligolepis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed lichen moss, is a member of the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, cryptogamic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil surfaces. The plant has a dense, cushion-like growth form with closely appressed leaves that are usually narrow and linear. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stalks and release spores when mature. Oligolepis angustifolia plays a vital ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing microhabitats for other organisms.
